vulnerability_findings.name: Unprotected Ether Withdrawal (SWC 105)
vulnerability_findings.message:
Any sender can withdraw Ether from the contract account.
Arbitrary senders other than the contract creator can profitably extract Ether from the contract account. Verify the business logic carefully and make sure that appropriate security controls are in place to prevent unexpected loss of funds.
Classification: SWC-105

vulnerability_findings.name: arbitrary-send
vulnerability_findings.message:
TestContract.withdrawAll (patch_7.sol#31-34) sends eth to arbitrary user
	Dangerous calls:
	- msg.sender.transfer(address(this).balance) (patch_7.sol#33)

vulnerability_findings.name: solc-version
vulnerability_findings.message:
Detected issues with version pragma in patch_7.sol:
	- pragma solidity^0.4.23 (patch_7.sol#1): it allows old versions

vulnerability_findings.name: naming-convention
vulnerability_findings.message: Parameter '_owner' of MultiOwnable.addOwner (patch_7.sol#17) is not in mixedCase

vulnerability_findings.name: naming-convention
vulnerability_findings.message: Parameter '_owner' of MultiOwnable.removeOwner (patch_7.sol#23) is not in mixedCase
